In the name of God the merciful and compassionate
(This is) a quittance for ʿAbdallāh [ibn Ḥanān] for one half dīnār (This is) a quittance for ʿAbdallah [ibn Hanan] for one half dīnār.
Sulayman ibn Ahwaz al-Hadrami received [and acquitted him] of an eighth, and it was established that there were no heirs to Harith ibn Sulaymān ibn Aḥwaz the Ḥaḍramī received [and acquitted him] of an eighth and it was established that there were no heirs to Ḥāriṯ ibn Sulaym ibn Aḥwaz the Ḥaḍramī (acquitted him) of the price of *** for the heirs of al-Ḥāriṯ ibn
[...] Es bezeugten (dies) ***(Name), Surayj al-Hadrami, and so he was acquitted of (the remainder). ʿAbdallah ibn Sulaym Surayj the Ḥaḍramī and so he was acquitted of it. He caused ʿAbdallāh ibn Sulaym
and Sulaym ibn Aḥwaz to bear witness to him and (also) ʿAbd al-Malik ibn Ayyūb and Sulaym ibn Aḥwaz witnessed the act in person, as did ʿAbd al-Malik ibn Ayyub, Sulaym ibn ʾAḥwar gegen sich selbst und ***(Name)
and it was written on Saturday, when three days (remained?) of Shawwal in the year 104. It was written on Saturday, when three days (remained?) of Šawwāl in the year one hundred
and four.
